snippet: Assemblyman William Scarborough, a Democrat, was arrested and accused of stealing at least $40,000 from New York State’s reimbursement system, as well as misusing campaign money.
abstract: Queens assemblyman William Scarborough, a Democrat, is arrested on charges of stealing from the state by seeking reimbursement for nonexistent travel expenses; Scarborough, who faces charges in state and federal court, is also accused of using campaign money for personal expenses; arrest is latest in a series of scandals involving New York State legislators.
lead_paragraph: Assemblyman William Scarborough, a Democrat, was arrested and accused of stealing at least $40,000 from New York State’s reimbursement system, as well as misusing campaign money.

headline.main: Queens Assemblyman Is Charged With Inflating Travel Expenses by $40,000
headline.print_headline: Queens Assemblyman Is Charged With Inflating Travel Expenses by $40,000
